time-phrase: The ruddy glow of sunset was already fading into the somber shadows of the night
Betwixt three and nine of the clock
place-phrase: straight down the crooked lane, and all around the square
that most fashionable of watering-places, Little Mendip
that Eighth Wonder of the world-- London
item: heavy chain armour habitually worn by tourists in that district
person-descriptor: with the agility of a fawn
who had never seen a joke in his life
place-descriptor: 'chockfull' (as the boys expressed it) from end to end
dialogue: 'Not an ounce more,' he added, with that love of metaphor so common in old age, 'and not a farthing less!'
His convulsed features and the deep wrinkles that chased each other across his manly brow, revealed the abyss of arithmetical agony into which one chance question had plunged him.
'I will not deceive you, gentlemen,' she said.
adventure-step: was assisting his mother-in-law to convince the dragon
having scorched the tail of the dragon, went away
